intro: Babiana torta, commonly known as the tortuous babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Babiana torta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a popular choice in rock gardens.
